title: Valles Caldera National Preserve: News Releases
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases               News Releases           Subscribe  | What is RSS     July 20, 2016  Valles Caldera Celebrates 16 Years – Free Entry Saturday  Valles Caldera National Preserve will celebrate its 16th birthday this Saturday, July 23rd from 10 am to 3 pm. Visitors will get an insider’s look at the scientific discoveries being made at the preserve and can take part in traditional “Earth-skills” demonstrations. Entrance to the preserve is free on Saturday for the family-friendly event.   July 15, 2016  Big Hat Fire Continues Benefiting Resources  With the higher temperatures and drier weather, fire managers are diligently monitoring the low-intensity Big Hat Fire. Located in the southwest corner of the Valles Caldera National Preserve, the lightning-caused fire remains at 235 acres.   July 08, 2016  Big Hat Fire Management Adapts To Warm, Dry Weather  The Big Hat Fire management team is adapting to the warmer, drier weather affecting New Mexico. Located in the southwest corner of the Valles Caldera National Preserve, the lightning caused fire has reached 235 acres.   July 04, 2016  Big Hat Fire To Become More Active With Drier Conditions  With drier conditions, fire activity and smoke are expected to increase with the lightning caused Big Hat Fire, now at 200 acres.  Fire managers will continue to take advantage of favorable conditions to meet management objectives to benefit resources within the Valles Caldera National Preserve.   July 01, 2016  Big Hat Fire Meeting Management Objectives  The lightning caused Big Hat Fire, now at 87 acres, is meeting management objectives to benefit resources within the Valles Caldera National Preserve. Fire managers will continue to take advantage of favorable conditions to burn out sections of land initially prepped to be burned this fall.   June 29, 2016  Fire Operations Increase on Managed Big Hat Fire  Fire management operations on the Big Hat fire will be taking advantage of favorable conditions to burn two sections of land that were originally planned to be burned this fall. As a result of the ignitions and burn out, increased smoke and fire activity will be visible.   June 27, 2016  Lightning Starts Small Fire at Preserve  A new wildland fire is burning in the Valles Caldera National Preserve. The Big Hat fire, discovered after last week's thunderstorms, is estimated to be approximately two acres in size.   June 26, 2016  Missing Bear Cubs Caught Saturday  Exactly one week after an adult female black bear was euthanized following an attack on a woman participating in a marathon event near Los Alamos, New Mexico Department of Game and Fish were able to recover her missing cubs.   June 18, 2016  Participant in Running Event on Valles Caldera Attacked by Black Bear  On Saturday, June 18, 2016 in midafternoon, a participant in a permitted running event on Valles Caldera National Preserve was attacked by a female American black bear when the individual came upon the bear’s cubs along a backcountry road being used as the event route.   May 10, 2016  Valles Caldera National Preserve Plans Prescribed Burn For Valle Grande  The Valles Caldera National Preserve is planning to implement a prescribed burn project on the preserve that will begin as soon as Wednesday, May 11 and be completed within two to three days.The prescribed burn will target up to 1,471 acres of grass in the Valle Grande, adjacent to NM Highway 4 between mile markers 39-42.
